author: Special Correspondent
text:
With nearly 23,000 people visiting the annual 3-day Fairpro — a property exhibition — and booking 322 homes worth Rs. 285 crore, the real estate market had now bounced back after a fairly gloomy spell, the event organisers said.

In a press release, Representatives of Confederation of Real Estate Developers Association of India (CREDAI), who organised the property fair, said the business transacted during the event had surpassed their expectations. Properties across price segments were on display from 80 promoters.

Ajit Kumar Chordia, president of CREDAI, Chennai, said: “Fairpro is a huge success and the response we have received is overwhelming. It reiterates the fact that consumers and developers appreciate a platform that is transparent and trustworthy when it comes to investment in real estate sector.”
title: Homes worth Rs. 285 crore booked at property fair
